verses.verse: A Song <WH7892> or Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph <WH623>. Keep not thou silence <WH1824>, O God <WH430>: hold not thy peace <WH2790>, and be not still <WH8252>, O God <WH410>.
For, lo, thine enemies <WH341> make a tumult <WH1993>: and they that hate <WH8130> thee have lifted up <WH5375> the head <WH7218>.
They have taken crafty <WH6191> counsel <WH5475> against thy people <WH5971>, and consulted <WH3289> against thy hidden ones <WH6845>.
They have said <WH559>, Come <WH3212>, and let us cut them off <WH3582> from being a nation <WH1471>; that the name <WH8034> of Israel <WH3478> may be no more in remembrance <WH2142>.
For they have consulted <WH3289> together <WH3162> with one consent <WH3820>: they are <WH3772> confederate <WH1285> against thee:
The tabernacles <WH168> of Edom <WH123>, and the Ishmaelites <WH3459>; of Moab <WH4124>, and the Hagarenes <WH1905>;
Gebal <WH1381>, and Ammon <WH5983>, and Amalek <WH6002>; the Philistines <WH6429> with the inhabitants <WH3427> of Tyre <WH6865>;
Assur <WH804> also is joined <WH3867> with them: they have holpen <WH2220> the children <WH1121> of Lot <WH3876>. Selah <WH5542>.
Do <WH6213> unto them as unto the Midianites <WH4080>; as to Sisera <WH5516>, as to Jabin <WH2985>, at the brook <WH5158> of Kison <WH7028>:
Which perished <WH8045> at En-dor <WH5874>: they became as dung <WH1828> for the earth <WH127>.
Make <WH7896> their nobles <WH5081> like Oreb <WH6159>, and like Zeeb <WH2062>: yea, all their princes <WH5257> as Zebah <WH2078>, and as Zalmunna <WH6759>:
Who said <WH559>, Let us take to ourselves the houses <WH4999> of God <WH430> in possession <WH3423>.
O my God <WH430>, make <WH7896> them like a wheel <WH1534>; as the stubble <WH7179> before <WH6440> the wind <WH7307>.
As the fire <WH784> burneth <WH1197> a wood <WH3293>, and as the flame <WH3852> setteth <WH3857> the mountains <WH2022> on fire <WH3857>;
So persecute <WH7291> them with thy tempest <WH5591>, and make them afraid <WH926> with thy storm <WH5492>.
Fill <WH4390> their faces <WH6440> with shame <WH7036>; that they may seek <WH1245> thy name <WH8034>, O LORD <WH3068>.
Let them be confounded <WH954> and troubled <WH926> for ever <WH5703>; yea, let them be put to shame <WH2659>, and perish <WH6>:
That men may know <WH3045> that thou, whose name <WH8034> alone is JEHOVAH <WH3068>, art the most high <WH5945> over all the earth <WH776>.
